20110117151008.000|20110117151011.000|TR0|to slow down and look at the victims first 
20110117151011.000|20110117151013.000|TR0|and then have a discussion about the 
20110117151013.000|20110117151016.000|TR0|politics a little bit later.  And then he

20110117151018.000|20110117151020.000|TR0|and said, "you're dead."  And then - then

20110117152957.000|20110117152959.000|TR0|to $6,000 a year for tuition, fees and 
20110117152959.000|20110117153002.000|TR0|books at any eligible Georgia university 
20110117153002.000|20110117153004.000|TR0|or technical school.

20110117153850.000|20110117153853.000|TR0|MCCOLLUM: Well, basically, it was like, 
20110117153853.000|20110117153855.000|TR0|you know, there was -- from the beginning

20110117153858.000|20110117153900.000|TR0|named, it kind of was like a community, 
20110117153900.000|20110117153902.000|TR0|well-put together community.  At the time, 
20110117153902.000|20110117153905.000|TR0|they were living the dream, but as you 
20110117153905.000|20110117153907.000|TR0|change throughout the years, things got 
20110117153907.000|20110117153910.000|TR0|worse and worse.  It was like they didn't 
20110117153910.000|20110117153912.000|TR0|really recognize the change.  They just

20110117153946.000|20110117153949.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  Sharniece, why such a 
20110117153949.000|20110117153951.000|TR0|disconnect between the legacy and the 
20110117153951.000|20110117153954.000|TR0|reality?  These are some of the most 
20110117153954.000|20110117153956.000|TR0|dangerous streets, the most violent areas 
20110117153956.000|20110117153959.000|TR0|that have MLK Boulevard or MLK Street.
20110117153959.000|20110117154001.000|TR0|
20110117154001.000|20110117154004.000|TR0|CHARNEICE FOX, DIRECTOR, "THE MLK STREETS 
20110117154004.000|20110117154006.000|TR0|PROJECT":  Well, you have to remember one 
20110117154006.000|20110117154009.000|TR0|thing.  Those streets have been renamed.  
20110117154009.000|20110117154011.000|TR0|The violence was there before, you know, 
20110117154011.000|20110117154013.000|TR0|in D.C. It was Nicolas Ave.  But it's not 
20110117154013.000|20110117154016.000|TR0|like these streets were created with the 
20110117154016.000|20110117154018.000|TR0|idea of just naming it MLK.  These streets 
20110117154018.000|20110117154021.000|TR0|have been renamed.
20110117154021.000|20110117154023.000|TR0|
20110117154023.000|20110117154026.000|TR0|So, the violence was there before it ever 
20110117154026.000|20110117154028.000|TR0|was decided to be Dr. Martin Luther King 
20110117154028.000|20110117154031.000|TR0|street.  And you also have to remember 
20110117154031.000|20110117154033.000|TR0|that with the exception of the memorial 
20110117154033.000|20110117154035.000|TR0|being built August 2011 here in 
20110117154035.000|20110117154038.000|TR0|Washington, the easiest thing for people 
20110117154038.000|20110117154040.000|TR0|to be able to do to honor someone in the 
20110117154040.000|20110117154043.000|TR0|black community is to use the street 
20110117154043.000|20110117154045.000|TR0|renaming as a way of honoring Dr. King.  
20110117154045.000|20110117154048.000|TR0|It's inexpensive.  It's something they can 
20110117154048.000|20110117154050.000|TR0|just do.  So oftentimes this happens in 
20110117154050.000|20110117154053.000|TR0|black communities.
20110117154053.000|20110117154055.000|TR0|
20110117154055.000|20110117154057.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  So Charniece, were you able to 
20110117154057.000|20110117154100.000|TR0|connect with anybody that maybe walks that 
20110117154100.000|20110117154102.000|TR0|street to work or home that maybe stops 
20110117154102.000|20110117154105.000|TR0|and pauses and thinks to themselves, wow, 
20110117154105.000|20110117154107.000|TR0|you know, I live on a street named about a 
20110117154107.000|20110117154110.000|TR0|man that changed my world, that changed my 
20110117154110.000|20110117154112.000|TR0|life?  Did you find any of that?
20110117154112.000|20110117154115.000|TR0|
20110117154115.000|20110117154117.000|TR0|FOX:  In some cases, yes.  But, you know, 
20110117154117.000|20110117154119.000|TR0|begin, because the street was renamed, 
20110117154119.000|20110117154122.000|TR0|it's just another street to a lot of 
20110117154122.000|20110117154124.000|TR0|individuals, which is unfortunate.  That 
20110117154124.000|20110117154127.000|TR0|makes us just want to think about why we 
20110117154127.000|20110117154129.000|TR0|do things to honor King in certain ways.
20110117154129.000|20110117154132.000|TR0|
20110117154132.000|20110117154134.000|TR0|But you know, definitely some people, when 
20110117154134.000|20110117154137.000|TR0|you had a conversation with them and -- 
20110117154137.000|20110117154139.000|TR0|you know, we had the kids just kind of go 
20110117154139.000|20110117154141.000|TR0|out in the street and just grab people off 
20110117154141.000|20110117154144.000|TR0|the street and ask them these questions.  
20110117154144.000|20110117154146.000|TR0|So, when it's brought to them directly, 
20110117154146.000|20110117154149.000|TR0|then of course they're like, you know, 
20110117154149.000|20110117154151.000|TR0|yes, we do live on King street and that is 
20110117154151.000|20110117154154.000|TR0|kind of important.  They do talk about the 
20110117154154.000|20110117154156.000|TR0|community and open up a little bit more.
20110117154156.000|20110117154159.000|TR0|
20110117154159.000|20110117154201.000|TR0|So for sure, when we had the opportunity 
20110117154201.000|20110117154203.000|TR0|to talk to people, they did talk about the 
20110117154203.000|20110117154206.000|TR0|fact that this is honoring King's legacy 
20110117154206.000|20110117154208.000|TR0|in whatever way.
20110117154208.000|20110117154211.000|TR0|
20110117154211.000|20110117154213.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  So finally A'lexus, did you 
20110117154213.000|20110117154216.000|TR0|anybody --
20110117154216.000|20110117154218.000|TR0|
20110117154218.000|20110117154221.000|TR0|GREAVES:  (INAUDIBLE).
20110117154221.000|20110117154223.000|TR0|
20110117154223.000|20110117154225.000|TR0|PHILLIPS: Go ahead, Nigel.       GREAVES:  
20110117154225.000|20110117154228.000|TR0|It's important to also recognize there's 
20110117154228.000|20110117154230.000|TR0|been actually been scholarly research on 
20110117154230.000|20110117154233.000|TR0|the topic.  It's not something that a joke 
20110117154233.000|20110117154235.000|TR0|has been made out of it.  It's something 
20110117154235.000|20110117154238.000|TR0|that really permeates the community in 
20110117154238.000|20110117154240.000|TR0|such a way that there are real 
20110117154240.000|20110117154243.000|TR0|conversations about it. And folks really 
20110117154243.000|20110117154245.000|TR0|do want to try to bridge that gap between 
20110117154245.000|20110117154248.000|TR0|the legacy and the circumstance in the 
20110117154248.000|20110117154250.000|TR0|neighborhoods.
20110117154250.000|20110117154252.000|TR0|
20110117154252.000|20110117154255.000|TR0|There's a professor that really helped us 
20110117154255.000|20110117154257.000|TR0|inform our research and our topical 
20110117154257.000|20110117154300.000|TR0|discussions and our interviews.  Derek 
20110117154300.000|20110117154302.000|TR0|Alderman is a professor at East Carolina 
20110117154302.000|20110117154305.000|TR0|University, and he did his doctoral 
20110117154305.000|20110117154307.000|TR0|research on the topic.  Totally gave us 
20110117154307.000|20110117154310.000|TR0|some great perspective, particularly on 
20110117154310.000|20110117154312.000|TR0|some of the streets we didn't make it to.  
20110117154312.000|20110117154314.000|TR0|There's -- it's important not to 
20110117154314.000|20110117154317.000|TR0|overgeneralize on the streets, but it's

20110117154447.000|20110117154450.000|TR0|new study has linked excessive gaming with 
20110117154450.000|20110117154452.000|TR0|mental health issues like depression and 
20110117154452.000|20110117154455.000|TR0|anxiety.  It's worth noting that the

20110117154522.000|20110117154524.000|TR0|study was they looked at about 3,000 kids 
20110117154524.000|20110117154526.000|TR0|in Singapore between third and eighth 
20110117154526.000|20110117154529.000|TR0|grade.  And nearly 10 percent of them had 
20110117154529.000|20110117154531.000|TR0|what the researchers called pathological 
20110117154531.000|20110117154534.000|TR0|gaming.  And as a result, had problems 
20110117154534.000|20110117154536.000|TR0|like depression and anxiety and problems 
20110117154536.000|20110117154539.000|TR0|in school.
20110117154539.000|20110117154541.000|TR0|
20110117154541.000|20110117154544.000|TR0|Now, you might think, well, these are kids
